alert.note: Alert for Henry; Rock Island; Whiteside (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 03 at 9:00AM CST until March 08 at 2:00PM CST by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Illinois... Rock River near Joslin affecting Rock Island, Whiteside and Henry IL Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Rock River near Joslin. * WHEN...Until early Wednesday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 12.0 feet, Water affects low lying agricultural land. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:45 AM CST Friday the stage was 12.2 feet. - Recent Activity...Steady at 12.2 feet. - Forecast...The river will fall below flood stage just after midnight tonight to 11.8 feet Sunday morning. It will then rise to 11.9 feet early Sunday afternoon. It will fall to 11.8 feet Monday morning. It will then rise to flood stage Wednesday morning. It will fall for the remainder of the period. - Flood stage is 12.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/quadcities. The next statement will be issued this afternoon.
